answers.answer: That is an interesting problem.  I can't tell you what to do with your medication, but there are several things I would do I was managing a similar problem with one of my own patients.1. It depends on how low your blood pressure is dropping and if you are having symptoms.  If a patient was having symptoms from low blood pressure, I would decrease the dose of medication or stop it all together.2. If the blood pressure before starting blood pressure medications was greater than 140/90 and now it is significantly lower (like an upper number less than 110 and lower number less than 70-75), I would consider decreasing the dose to Amlodac to once daily.  Amoldac could be taken once a day anyway, so changing to once a day is unlikely to do any harm.Make sure you contact your doctor when you get home.  I hope my hypothetical scenario helps.  Enjoy your trip and thanks for posting.
What was your BP and what is it now?  How old are you and what other risk factors do you have?
If you do decide to decrease your dose, make sure you keep checking your pressure to ensure it doesn't go right back up.....
